questions.text: In a person on a high potassium diet, which part of the nephron would be expected to secrete the most potassium?
Which nephron segment is the primary site of magnesium reabsorption in normal conditions?

options.label: B
options.text: Descending thin segment of loop of henle

options.label: C
options.text: Thick ascending limb of loop of henle

questions.correct_answer: C. Thick ascending limb of loop of henle

questions.text: A 55-year old male has renovascular hypertension as a result of renal artery stenosis of left kidney. Which of the following is an unlikely finding in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Increased renal afferent arteriolar pressure

questions.text: Which of the following has the highest clearance?
Tubular concentration of which of the following substances will be the highest at the end of PCT?
Which set of changes would be expected to occur in response to direct increases in renal arterial pressure without an intact tubuloglomerular feedback system?

A patient has a GFR of 100mL/min, urine flow rate of 2mL/min and a plasma glucose concentration of 200mg/dL. If the T mG (transport maxima for Glucose) is 250mg/min, what would be this patient’s rate of glucose excretion?
At which site in the nephron will the concentration of creatinine be the highest in a normally hydrated person?
Given below are the renal clearance curves for different substances If C is renal clearance of Inulin, curve D corresponds to renal clearance of which of the following substances?
Which of the following substances has the highest TF/P ratios at the end of the PCT?
All of the following increase GFR except?

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in glomerular capillary ultrafiltration coefficient

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in glomerular capillary colloid osmotic pressure

questions.correct_answer: C. Increase in glomerular capillary colloid osmotic pressure

questions.text: In conditions associated with very high ADH secretion, such as dehydration, maximum water reabsorption occurs in which of the following segments of the nephron?
Sensor for tubuloglomerular feedback is which of the following?
Acidification of the urine occurs in which of the following segments of the nephron?
All of the following cause a mesangial cell contraction except
A high potassium diet is most likely to produce which of the following changes?
Which of the following acquaporins is involved in water reabsorption from the PCT?

If the average hydrostatic pressure in the glomerular capillaries is 50 mm Hg, the hydrostatic pressure in the Bowman’s space is 12 mm Hg, the average colloid osmotic pressure in the glomerular capillaries is 30 mm Hg, and there is no protein in the glomerular ultrafiltrate, what is the net pressure driving glomerular filtration?
Calculate the rate of potassium excretion from the following data Creatinine clearance = 90mL/min Plasma K+ = 4mEq/ L Urine K+= 60mEq/ L Urine flow rate = 1mL/ min
The maximum clearance rate possible for a substance that is totally cleared from the plasma is equal to which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Urinary excretion rate of that substance

questions.text: Which changes would you expect to find after administration of a vasodilator drug that caused a 50% decrease in afferent arteriolar resistance and no change in arterial pressure?

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased renal blood flow, decreased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Increased renal blood flow, increased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased renal blood flow, increased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

options.label: D
options.text: Increased renal blood flow, decreased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

questions.correct_answer: B. Increased renal blood flow, increased glomerular capillary hydrostatic pressure

questions.text: The GFR of a 50-year-old man decreases by 50% and remains at that level. Plasma concentration of which of the following substances will be increased to the greatest extent?
The graph given below depicts filterability of dextran through the kidney, 1 representing complete filtration and 0 representing no filtration. Which of the following are A, B and C respectively?
Which of the following will occur in a dehydrated person deprived of water for more than 24 hours?

options.label: D
options.text: Increased water permeability in the collecting ducts

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased water permeability in the collecting ducts

questions.text: Which of the following is true about the tubular fluid that passes through the lumen of the early distal tubule in the region of the macula densa?
Which of the following decreases in length during a muscle contraction?
Motor end plate potential at neuro- muscular junctions is mainly due to which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Sodium influx through voltage-gated sodium channels

options.label: B
options.text: Sodium influx through ligand-gated sodium channels

options.label: C
options.text: Potassium efflux through voltage-gated potassium channels

options.label: D
options.text: Potassium efflux through ligand-gated potassium channels

questions.correct_answer: B. Sodium influx through ligand-gated sodium channels

questions.text: Which of the following statements comparing fast-twitch and slow-twitch muscle fibres is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Fast-twitch muscle fibres are more dependent on the phosphagen and glycogen- lactic acid systems

options.label: B
options.text: Fast-twitch muscle fibres have more myoglobin

options.label: C
options.text: Fewer capillaries surround slow-twitch muscle fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Fast twitch muscle fibres are smaller in diameter

questions.correct_answer: A. Fast-twitch muscle fibres are more dependent on the phosphagen and glycogen- lactic acid systems

questions.text: Most of the energy for strenuous exercise that lasts for more than 5- 10 seconds but less than 1 to 2 minutes comes from which of the following?

The following events occur at an excitatory synapse. A. Ligand- gated channels open in the post synaptic membrane to allow influx of sodium B. Synaptic vesicles bind to pre-synaptic membrane C. Depolarization of pre-synaptic membrane D. Opening of calcium channels cause influx of calcium Which of the following is the correct sequence?

A 65- year-old man presented with progressive leg weakness and a diagnosis of LEMS (Lambert- Eaton myasthenic syndrome) was made by serial repetitive nerve stimulation test. Which of the following channels are affected in Lamber-Eaton syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Voltage- gated calcium channels on pre- synaptic membrane

options.label: B
options.text: Voltage- gated calcium channels on post- synaptic membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Ligand- gated sodium channels on pre- synaptic membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Ligand- gated sodium channels on post- synaptic membrane

questions.correct_answer: A. Voltage- gated calcium channels on pre- synaptic membrane

questions.text: Which of the following best describes a motor unit?

options.label: A
options.text: Single Aα motor neuron and all the muscle fibres it supplies

options.label: B
options.text: Single muscle fibre and all the Aα motor neurons supplying it

options.label: C
options.text: Single sensory neuron and all the muscle fibres it supplies

options.label: D
options.text: Single muscle fibre and all the sensory neurons supplying it

questions.correct_answer: A. Single Aα motor neuron and all the muscle fibres it supplies

questions.text: Given below is a graph of the length-tension relationship. Which of the following are true regarding optimum length? (multiple correct options).

options.label: A
options.text: Optimum length corresponds to a sarcomere length of 2- 2.2 microns

options.label: B
options.text: There are maximum number of actin- myosin cross bridges at optimum length

options.label: C
options.text: There is minimum overlap between actin and myosin

options.label: D
options.text: Optimum length is also known as the resting length

options.label: E
options.text: At optimum length, active and passive tension are maximum.

questions.text: Each molecule of troponin C can bind how many calcium ions?
Acetylcholine receptors on the motor end plate are which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Voltage gated sodium and potassium channels

options.label: D
options.text: Ligand gated sodium and potassium channels

questions.correct_answer: D. Ligand gated sodium and potassium channels

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct sequence of events in skeletal muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: Muscle action potential, muscle contraction, nerve action potential

options.label: B
options.text: Nerve action potential, muscle contraction, muscle action potential

options.label: C
options.text: Muscle contraction, nerve action potential, muscle action potential

options.label: D
options.text: Nerve action potential, muscle action potential, muscle contraction

questions.correct_answer: D. Nerve action potential, muscle action potential, muscle contraction

questions.text: Shown below is an electron microscopic picture of a sarcomere. Which of the following represent the H-zone?
Which of the following is greater in afterloaded muscle contractions as compared to preloaded muscle contractions?

A 55-year-old woman visits her physician because of double vision, drooping of eyelids, difficulty in chewing and swallowing, and general weakness in her limbs. All these symptoms worsen with exercise and occur more frequently late in the day. The physician suspects myasthenia gravis and orders a Tensilon test. The test is positive. What is the most likely basis for the symptoms described in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Depletion of voltage-gated calcium channels in certain motor neurons

options.label: B
options.text: Development of macro motor units after recovery from poliomyelitis

options.label: C
options.text: Over exertion resulting in junction fatigue

questions.text: A 18- year old football player sustained a left tibial fracture. The left lower leg was placed in a cast for 8 weeks. After the cast was removed the left gastrocnemius muscle was found to be significantly smaller in circumference than the right. What is the most likely explanation?

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease in the number of individual muscle fibres in the left gastrocnemius

options.label: B
options.text: Decrease in blood flow to the muscle caused by constriction from the cast

options.label: C
options.text: Temporary reduction in actin and myosin protein synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in glycolytic activity in the affected muscle

questions.correct_answer: C. Temporary reduction in actin and myosin protein synthesis

questions.text: An apparently healthy 15-year-old boy dies during a minor surgical procedure while under general anesthesia. The boy’s grandfather has also died during a surgical procedure. A clinical assessment team determines that the child had malignant hyperthermia (MH). MH is an inherited disease in which the triggering agents, such as certain anesthetics, stimulate calcium release from storage sites in muscle, leading to elevated concentration of sarcoplasmic calcium. The MH crisis is most likely to be associated with which of the following?
Which of the following is responsible for elasticity in skeletal muscle?
During a graded activity which of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Fast muscle fibres are recruited before slow muscle fibres

options.label: B
options.text: Large muscle fibres are recruited before small muscle fibres

options.label: C
options.text: Well perfused muscle fibres are recruited before poorly perfused muscle fibres

options.label: D
options.text: Strong muscle fibres are recruited before weak muscle fibres

questions.correct_answer: C. Well perfused muscle fibres are recruited before poorly perfused muscle fibres

questions.text: Resting length corresponds with a which of the following sarcomere lengths?
Given below is the myogram of a single muscle twitch. What is the tetanizing frequency?

A 50-year old woman was admitted to the hospital with symptoms of nausea and vomiting for about 2 days followed by severe muscle weakness and neurologic symptoms, including ptosis and dysphagia. She gave a history of having eaten at a restaurant the evening before the symptoms began. Laboratory tests were positive for Clostridium botulinum. The basis for the muscle weakness in this case was most likely because the toxin

options.label: A
options.text: Blocked the reuptake of neurotransmitter into pre-synaptic terminals

options.label: B
options.text: Bound irreversibly to the receptors on the post-synaptic membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Prevented release of acetylcholine from motor neurons

options.label: D
options.text: Reached the cell body of the motor neuron by diffusion into the spinal cord

questions.correct_answer: C. Prevented release of acetylcholine from motor neurons

questions.text: All of the following are sarcolemmal proteins except
Which of the following is produced type of heat is produced only in a muscle contracting isotonically?
Which of the following is associated with mutation of the genes coding for sarcoglycans?
All of the following are features of complete tetanus except?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no relaxation between successive contractions

options.label: B
options.text: There are periods of incomplete relaxation between successive contractions

options.label: C
options.text: Tension developed during a complete tetanus is about four times that developed by individual twitch contractions

options.label: D
options.text: Stimulation frequency at which summation of contractions occurs producing complete tetanus is determined by the contraction period of that particular muscle

questions.correct_answer: B. There are periods of incomplete relaxation between successive contractions
